src:
PSIS Kalah 1-2 dari Persib, Banur Cukup Puas dengan Pemainnya
06 Nov 2019, 15:16 by Aminuddin, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Pelatih PSIS Semarang, Bambang Nurdiansyah alias Banur, mengaku bangga dengan penampilan anak asuhnya meski kalah tipis 1-2 dari Persib Bandung dalam laga lanjutan Liga 1 yang berlangsung di Stadion Si Jalak Harupat, Kabupaten Bandung, Rabu, 6 November 2019, malam.
"PSIS tidak kalah mainnya lawan Persib meski lawan main di home. Saya di sini baru dua bulan menggantikan pelatih yang lama. Ada progres dan saya cukup puas dengan penampilan PSIS," ucap Banur usai laga berakhir.
Persib membuka keunggulan lewat gol yang dicetak Ezechiel N'Douassel pada menit kesembilan. Namun, pada awal babak kedua, tepatnya menit 53, PSIS berhasil menyamakan kedudukan melalui sepakan Bruno Alves. Persib akhirnya berhasil kembali unggul menit 73 melalui tendangan penalti Febri Hariyadi. Setelahnya, tak ada gol lagi yang tercipta hingga pertandingan usai.
Menurut Banur, secara keseluruhan pertandingan antara Persib dan PSIS berlangsung menarik. Kedua kesebelasan saling berbalas menyerang dalam laga itu. Bahkan, kata dia, pemainnya berhasil menguasai jalannya laga seusai mencetak gol penyeimbang pada awal babak kedua.
"Saya pikir kalau ditanya pertandingan tadi menarik ya. Itulah sepak bola, kami menguasai permainan di akhir babak kedua. Setelah 1-1 banyak peluang yang kami ciptakan tetapi keberuntungan lagi ada di Persib Bandung," ujarnya.
Banur mengatakan anakan asuhnya memang agak kelabakan di babak pertama. Hari Nur Yulianto dan kawan-kawan tampak tak bisa meladeni permainan yang disodorkan oleh tuan rumah Persib. Hal itu, kata dia, menjadi bahan evaluasi bagi anak asuhnya ke depannya.
"Nanti ini akan dievaluasi mungkin pemanasan kurang. Nanti akan dievaluasi sama pelatih fisik saya. Tapi sepak bola, kalau kalah ada saja masalahnya, kalau menang yang salah juga jadi bagus," kata dia.
Skuad berjulukan Laskar Mahesa Jenar itu kini menempati peringkat 13 klasemen sementara Liga 1 dengan torehan 28 poin saja. PSIS berada di posisi tak nyaman lantaran hanya terpaut lima poin saja dari tim berperingkat terendah yakni Semen Padang.

AMINUDDIN A.S.
text:
PSIS Lose 1-2 from Persib, Banur is Quite Satisfied with the Players
Nov 6 2019, 15:16 by Aminuddin, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Semarang PSIS coach, Bambang Nurdiansyah alias Banur, said he was proud of the appearance of his teammates despite being narrowly defeated 1-2 from Persib Bandung in the continued match of League 1 which took place at the Si Jalak Harupat Stadium, Bandung Regency, Wednesday, November 6 2019, tonight
"PSIS does not lose playing against Persib even though the opponent plays at home. I am only here for two months replacing the old coach. There is progress and I am quite satisfied with PSIS's performance," Banur said after the match ended.
Persib opened the scoring through goals scored by Ezechiel N'Douassel in the ninth minute. However, at the beginning of the second half, precisely 53 minutes, PSIS managed to equalize through Bruno Alves kicking. Persib finally managed to get back ahead 73 minutes through a penalty kick Febri Hariyadi. After that, no more goals were created until the match was over.
According to Banur, overall the match between Persib and PSIS was interesting. The two teams reciprocated in that fight. In fact, he said, his players managed to master the game after scoring a goal equalizer at the start of the second half.
"I think when asked about the match it was interesting. That is football, we mastered the game at the end of the second half. After 1-1 many opportunities we created but luck was again at Persib Bandung," he said.
Banur said the foster puppies were a bit out of touch in the first round. Hari Nur Yulianto and his friends seemed unable to serve the game offered by the host Persib. That, he said, would be an evaluation material for his foster children in the future.
"Later this will be evaluated, maybe warming up is lacking. Later it will be evaluated by my physical coach. But football, if you lose there are problems, if you win the wrong one it also becomes good," he said.
The squad nicknamed Laskar Mahesa Jenar is now ranked 13th in the League 1 standings with just 28 points. PSIS is in an uncomfortable position because it is only five points adrift of the lowest ranked team namely Semen Padang.

AMINUDDIN U.S.
